title: Chinese Garlic Sauce for Stir Fry's
content:
Chinese Garlic Sauce for Stir Fry

 

This garlic sauce recipe can be used with most any protein. Common dishes in Chinese takeout joints include the snappily named Beef with Garlic Sauce and Chicken in Garlic Sauce. So does that have garlic in it? What type of protein? Can I get the Beef with Garlic Sauce, but substitute the beef with tofu?

Oh. This is from the wonderful Spruce Eats website (I'm not claiming credit for this recipe, just saving it for later reference)

https://www.thespruceeats.com/chinese-garlic-sauce-for-stir-fries-4066674

 

  • 2 tbsp rice vinegar
  • 2 tbsp sugar
  • 1 tbsp light soy sauce (combine light and dark soy sauce measurements if you're using standard grocery store soy sauces)
  • 1 tbsp dark soy sauce
  • 2 tsp Chinese rice wine (substitute dry sherry if needed)
  • 1/2 tsp chili sauce (Sriracha or similar; use enough for your tastes; don't burn out the kids' mouths, but keep it interesting)
  • 1/4 tsp sesame oil
  • 1 1/2 tsp corn starch
  • 1 tbsp water
  • 1 tbsp vegetable oil (or peanut oil)
  • 3 - 4 cloves minced garlic

  1. Combine the rice vinegar, sugar, soy sauces, rice wine or sherry, chili sauce and sesame oil in a small bowl, stirring to combine.

  2. In a separate small bowl, dissolve the cornstarch in water.

  3. Heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat in a saucepan. Add the garlic and cook, stirring until aromatic (around 30 seconds).

  4. Quickly re-stir the sauce, add it to the saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring. (This will take about a minute).

  5. Re-stir the cornstarch-water mixture and add it to the sauce, stirring to thicken.

  6. Done - use it in a stir fry recipe
